É super triste o rumo que esse jogo tomou, colocaram um sistema de mmr usando um data base geral, e dão nerf e buffs baseado na data base geral, nunca nenhuma empresa deveria balancear o jogo de acordo com a maioria e sim, nos melhores players, acabou que o jogo ficou estressante para pessoas que conseguem jogar melhor, tanto pra sobreviventes quanto para killers, os killers sao reféns dos sobreviventes, e se você é um sobrevivente que joga bem, mas quer ser mais ''devagar'' ou ''chill'' em uma partida, você nao é capaz de fazer isso. Para pessoas casuais de mmr baixo ou médio o jogo é perfeito, pra pessoas que entendem do jogo e sabem o que tão fazendo é apenas experiencias estressantes dos dois lados... basearam mmr de killer por kills e nao por ganchos, o que basicamente chama os killers para campar e tirar uma pessoa do game, e coitado do killer se pegar um SWF que sabe jogar, ele apenas vira um brinquedo na mão dos sobreviventes.
Jeu juste trop bien. Presque 300H dessus je m'ennuis jamais. (Mais PAR CONTRE DES TOXIQUES IL Y EN A) mais quand même jeu vraiment fun.

给大家分享一些调理高血压的方法
一、合理膳食

1、首先要控制能量的摄入，提倡吃复合糖类、如淀粉、玉米，少吃葡萄糖，因其属于单糖，易引起血脂升高。

2、 限制脂肪的摄入。烹调时，选用植物油，可多吃海鱼，海鱼可降低胆固醇，抑制血栓形成，防止中风。

3、适量摄入蛋白质。每周吃2-3次鱼类蛋白质，可改善血管弹性和通透性，增加尿钠排出，从而降低血压。如高血压合并肾功能不全时，应限制蛋白质的摄入。


高血压患者应该合理膳食
4、多吃含钾、钙丰富而含钠低的食品，如土豆、茄子、海带、莴笋。含钙高的食品：牛奶、酸牛奶、虾皮。少吃肉汤类，因为肉汤中含氮浸出物增加，能够促进体内尿酸增加，加重心、肝、肾脏的负担。

5、限制盐的摄入量：每日应逐渐减至6g以下(普通饮料瓶盖一平盖食盐约为6g)。适当的减少钠盐的摄入有助于降低血压。

6、多吃新鲜蔬菜，水果。每天吃新鲜蔬菜不少于8两，水果2至4两。

二、戒烟限酒

吸烟会导致高血压。研究证明，吸一支烟后收缩压增加10-25mmHg。长期大量吸烟还会促进动脉硬化。无高血压的人戒烟可预防高血压的发生，有高血压的人更应戒烟。

与吸烟相比，饮酒对身体的利弊就存在争议。有的说饮少量酒有益，有的说有害，但可以肯定的一点是，大量饮酒肯定有害，高浓度的酒精会导致动脉硬化，加重高血压。


高血压患者应该戒烟戒酒
三、适量运动

运动对高血压很重要，有句话说：“年轻时，用健康换取金钱，年老时，用运动换取健康。”运动除了可以促进血液循环，降低胆固醇的生成外，并能减少肌肉、骨骼与关节僵硬的发生。运动能增加食欲，促进肠胃蠕动、预防便秘、改善睡眠。要养成持续运动的好习惯，最好是做有氧运动，如散步、慢跑、太极拳、骑自行车和游泳都是有氧运动。


高血压患者应该多运动锻炼身体
1、勿过量或太强太累，要采取循序渐进的方式来增加活动量。

2、进行运动时，切勿空腹，以免发生低血糖，应在饭后2小时。

四、使用辅助治疗高血压仪器设备，如降压血压仪，每日利用降压血压仪对高血压进行辅助治疗，每日坚持做2-3次，可达到降血压、稳定血压的效果。


高血压患者应该多用辅助治疗仪器
五、自我管理

1、定期测量血压，每天应至少测量一次

2、定时服用降压药，自己不随意减量或停药，可在医生指导下根据病情加予调整，防止血压反跳。

3、最好自备血压计并学会自测血压

This is a roller coaster of a game, that is very hard to review properly.

The game play loop of this game is actually very repetitive but highly addicting because of the degree of variance in this game. Speaking of which as survivors your goal is to escape from the killer normally by powering the exit gates by fixing 5 generators. However you'll need to get good at trying to loop and escape the killer or you'll wind up on the hook, you can be rescued but you can only get hooked twice before the 3rd one is death. Killer's add a ton of variety and is what makes this game shine. Each killer has unique mechanics that makes fighting them feel invigorating and playing as them fun.

Now with that said there is a perk system for survivors and killers, where they have access to unique and common perks, which after you level your survivor sufficiently with enough bloodpoints you can make that survivors perks teachable to other survivors. The same system applies to killers. My biggest grievance with this system is the incredibly grindy nature of trying to get your desirable perks on your character as its literally a process of rng and elimination. You can luck out and max level your perk right away or have to continue leveling your blood web until it shows up. The power difference between level 1 versions of a perk and 3 is often night and day. There is also a serious perk balance issue, a good chunk of perks provide so little value in a game they are borderline useless for both killer's and survivors, while other perks are so blatantly powerful that virtually every survivor and killer is running at least one of them.

Another grievance I have is the incredible amount of time limited content in this game, every so often Behaviour releases time limited events that give away a ton of free blood points for signing in, inputting silly codes into the cash store or a new tome. Tomes are actually a really nice addition to the game, as it provides another source of highly desired bloodpoints and thankfully you can do older tomes for the bloodpoints you just can't get the cosmetics associated with them as they are time gated. It is nice these cosmetics are mostly available in the game store if you missed out. But if you are a completionist that hates missing out well you'll never be happy then. Honestly, if you are still interested in buying this game pick it up on sale. You'll inevitably want some of the dlc anyways as there is a lot of powerful perks locked away in them, and while technically there is a free to play way to get them from the shrine that is again purely rng that the ones you are looking for will even show up in there.

I would recommend this game, but exercise caution as it can be quite rage inducing until you get established.
Pick it up on sale and ideally do some research and get familiar with some of the mechanics as well before getting thrown in to what is probably one of the few good asymmetric pvp horror games.

Behaviour needs to do something about the bloodpoint grind as the requirements for new players is quite steep, you need about 1million bloodpoints on average to unlock all the teachable perks for a specific character to even just have a chance of showing up in another character's bloodweb. Where on average you are expecting 20~30k bloodpoints per game played. Established players play so much they already have everything maxed out anyways and are swimming in bloodpoints, but if new players can't even get some sort of bone to have a chance of competing they'll likely just quit before they even get to that stage. New players are also less likely to be aware of these silly codes that are often worth a ton of bloodpoints. They also need to do some serious reworks and buffs for the undesirable perks for killers/survivors. Almost a quarter of the perks are so situational they are effectively useless in most games. The gap between level 1 and 3 perks could also be shrunken a bit as well to help new players stand on their feet a bit better.

Alot of people have a lot of complaints about community toxicity, and How long it takes to get anywhere, things like that. I got the base version, and ended up buying the killer expansion and the cannibal expansion, and so far I have loved every hour. The game actually feels decently well balanced, although I know a lot of people don't think that. For the most part, people are respectful, and because of how limited the chat options are in game its really hard to be toxic. People talk about toxic behaviour but I've found honestly that toxic behavior really doesn't help you win games. all in all ive had a great experience and definately recommend

I am a HIGHLY SKILLED Dead by Daylight (DbD) player
Welcome to my profile!



I am a highly skilled rank 3 Dead by Daylight (DbD) player. If you have played with me, you will know I am highly skilled and maybe one day you can achieve my greatness at this game Dead by Daylight (DbD).



As a professional at this game, Dead by Daylight (DbD), I only play it and nothing else, to make sure my skill level is at its best at all times.



If I am killer and facecamped you it is because of one of the following reasons:



You used flashlight in a toxic way (Blinded me)

You pallet stunned me when I picked up a survivor

You tea bagged against me

You cleansed my Devour Hope totem

You finished gen in front of me before I could grab you

You hook dived and your teammate got away because of Borrowed Time (BT)

You play Blendette

You rushed gen too fast

You are using Object of Obsession (OoO), a very troll perk



As a survivor, I WILL make sure you lose with my high skill if you:



Use Noone Escapes Death (NOED)

Stay within the hook more than ten seconds (I COUNT!!)

Camp a generator

Try to 3-gen the Survivors (survs)

Play the Spirit

Play Wraith and uncloak while chasing

Hook someone in the basement as Leatherface

Use Iridescent Hatchets as the Huntress

You play Ghostface and don't get revealed when I am looking at you (Hacker!!)

Find me when I am hiding even when I use Iron Will

If you go back to hook after someone is rescued (G-O F-O-R G-E-N-S NOOB)



If you stick to these very simple rules of conduct in Dead by Daylight (DbD), everyone will have much more fun and maybe one day you can become as skilled as me.



See you in the fog.
